meanings.definition: Willfully causing pain or suffering to others.
meanings.sent1: The cruel teacher gave extra homework to the students.
meanings.sent2: The cruel winter wind made everyone shiver.
meanings.sent3: It was cruel of the rain to ruin the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The cruel reality of the situation hit him hard.
meanings.sent5: The cruel bully made the other kids feel miserable.

meanings.sent1: The cruel punishment for breaking the rules was no recess.
meanings.sent2: The cruel punishment for being late was detention.
meanings.sent3: The cruel punishment for losing the game was doing extra chores.
meanings.sent4: The cruel winter storm left the town without power.
meanings.sent5: The cruel judge sentenced the criminal to many years in prison.

meanings.sent1: The cruel heat of the desert made it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent2: The cruel pain in his leg made it difficult to walk.
meanings.sent3: The cruel competition pushed everyone to their limits.
meanings.sent4: The cruel reality of the situation sank in slowly.
meanings.sent5: The cruel hunger after the long hike was unbearable.
